message_1: In a Vigenere cipher with a keyword "MATH", Alice encrypted a message "ATTACKATDAWN" and sent it to Bob. If Bob knows the true keyword is "MATH" and uses Cryptanalysis to decrypt the message, what is the resulting decrypted message?
message_2:
To decrypt the message using the Vigenere cipher and the keyword "MATH", we need to reverse the encryption process. The Vigenere cipher works by shifting each letter in the plaintext by a certain number of positions, determined by the corresponding letter in the keyword.

First, we need to extend the keyword to match the length of the message:

MATHMATHMATHM

Now, we will reverse the encryption process by shifting each letter in the encrypted message back by the number of positions determined by the corresponding letter in the extended keyword:

Encrypted message: ATTACKATDAWN
Extended keyword:  MATHMATHMATHM

A - M = A (shift back 12 positions)
T - A = T (shift back 0 positions)
T - T = T (shift back 19 positions)
A - H = C (shift back 7 positions)
C - M = K (shift back 12 positions)
K - A = K (shift back 0 positions)
A - T = T (shift back 19 positions)
T - D = D (shift back 3 positions)
D - A = A (shift back 0 positions)
A - W = W (shift back 22 positions)
W - N = N (shift back 13 positions)

The decrypted message is: ATTACKATDAWN
